comment.body:
Why not an IPFS site: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17zvBL3FBNDSV5x7EoGv2LdFe473iw9dVZ/?/hashes/QmZMmRynEbrPoGQC7M1zgHwt5vHWiUBr1bzHRa8ndd7f2j ?
This is my site, with a poor UI design.

@Loligod: I think IPFS have a much higher resource reuse rate than ZeroNet. Even though it's harder to use a IPFS & ZeroNet collaboration site than a pure ZeroNet site, I think IPFS is more promising.

@Loligod: Of course, the IPFS js implementation, let's forget it. I don't know why people build things like ipfs js and webtorrent. We can almost say that nothing can be seeded in browser, unless they are build in ServiceWorker(but it seems there is still some problems).
@Loligod: You played a movie in browser with webtorrent, then you refreshed the page, eh, sadly, you'll download it again. So, the browser can seed only when the page is open.
